intro: Elleanthus hymenophorus, commonly known as the Cape dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular florets, typical of the family. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Elleanthus hymenophorus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
